text: these are no ordinary footballs they
will be used during World Cup matches
kicked by some of the most famous
footballing feet on the planet this
Factory in Salford in northeastern
Pakistan is one of only two factories in
the world which has the contract to make
footballs for the World Cup the other
one is in China footballs like these
used to be hand-stitched but Pakistan
got left behind when the technology
developed for machine stitching it took
10 years for the factory here to catch
up with its Chinese competitors and that
meant a decade without a contract the
technology changed and some look back
then Pakistani companies did not have
the most up-to-date technology the
Chinese companies were smarter and
advanced they were able to produce more
footballs with that technology at good
prices
it took a 1.1 million dollars investment
to upgrade the factory now the new
machines are in place the contract has
been renewed and the footballs are
coming off the production line the
workers here say that it will be a
moment of glory to see these footballs
in the stadiums in Brazil for the cella
Airport men are they able it takes a lot
of hard work to make these footballs and
we feel proud that our footballs will be
going to Brazil for the World Cup I will
be watching the game on TV with my
family meant by that Pakistan is better
known for its cricket the country has a
long way to go before it puts itself on
the football map but for now these balls
have put the country back in the
beautiful game show Malaysia free BBC
news Sialkot
